Gorilla trekking in Volcanoes National Park is a once-in-a-lifetime experience! Permits cost $1,500 per person and should be booked 6-12 months in advance. The trek can take 1-8 hours through beautiful rainforest terrain.

Mountain gorilla trekking in Rwanda's Volcanoes National Park offers incredible encounters with these gentle giants. You'll be assigned to a gorilla family and accompanied by experienced trackers and guides.

patterns: When is the best time to visit Rwanda
responses: The best time to visit Rwanda is during the dry seasons: June to September and December to February. These months offer optimal conditions for gorilla trekking and wildlife viewing with less rainfall.
Rwanda has a temperate climate year-round. For trekking, the dry seasons (Jun-Sep and Dec-Feb) are ideal. The rainy seasons (Mar-May and Oct-Nov) are lush and green but trails can be muddy.

Rwanda offers diverse accommodation from luxury lodges to budget options. Near Volcanoes National Park: Bisate Lodge, Sabyinyo Silverback Lodge. In Nyungwe: One&Only Nyungwe House. In Kigali: The Retreat, Kigali Serena Hotel.
For luxury: Wilderness Bisate Lodge, One&Only Gorilla's Nest. Mid-range: Sabyinyo Silverback Lodge, Five Volcanoes Boutique Hotel. Budget: Kinigi Guesthouse, Garden Place Hotel.

Experience authentic Rwandan culture at Iby'Iwacu Cultural Village near Volcanoes National Park. You'll see traditional Intore dance performances, learn about local customs, and interact with community members.

Rwanda's rich culture includes traditional dances like Intore, beautiful Imigongo art, and the famous Kinyarwanda language. Visit the Ethnographic Museum in Huye or Kandt House Museum in Kigali to learn more.
Akagera National Park offers incredible safari experiences with lions, elephants, giraffes, zebras, and over 500 bird species. Boat trips on Lake Ihema provide unique wildlife viewing opportunities.
Rwanda's Akagera National Park is home to the Big Five (lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, rhino). The park has been successfully restored and now offers excellent game drives and bird watching.

Nyungwe Forest National Park is one of Africa's oldest rainforests with 13 primate species including chimpanzees. Don't miss the canopy walkway - 70 meters above the forest floor with breathtaking views!
Nyungwe offers chimpanzee tracking, colobus monkey encounters, and the incredible canopy walk. The park has over 1,000 plant species and 300 bird species, making it a biodiversity hotspot.
In Kigali, visit the Kigali Genocide Memorial, Kimironko Market, and Kandt House Museum. Enjoy local cuisine at Repub Lounge or The Hut. The city is clean, safe, and offers beautiful hilltop views.
Kigali highlights include: Kigali Genocide Memorial, Caplaki Craft Village for souvenirs, Kimironko Market for local experience, and Inema Arts Center for contemporary Rwandan art.

Rwanda has good road networks. Options include: rental cars, private drivers, moto-taxis in cities, and public buses between major towns. Domestic flights connect Kigali to Kamembe near Nyungwe Forest.

For getting around: hire a car with driver for convenience, use modern buses for intercity travel, or rent a 4x4 for national park visits. Motorcycle taxis (motos) are popular for short distances in cities.

Try traditional Rwandan dishes like: Ugali (maize porridge), Ibihaza (pumpkin stew), Isombe (cassava leaves), and Brochettes (grilled meat skewers). Fresh fruits like passion fruit and tree tomatoes are delicious!

Rwandan cuisine features plantains, beans, sweet potatoes, and fresh vegetables. Popular dishes: Matoke (plantain stew), Akabenz (pork), and fresh fish from Lake Kivu. Don't miss the local coffee and tea!
